posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
An unarmed Monk is better that a kama Monk in a low-magic world, Clerics are always good, especially in low-magic worlds, your world allows GMW and DF on fists, so the obvious choice is an unarmed Cleric / Monk, but there are problems with that. You need at least 16 levels of Monk for the d20 unarmed damage, and at least 24 levels of Cleric to be undispellable, but that leaves no room for a third class, and more importantly, you either get that d20 damage really late, or you get your last Tumble skill dump really early, which gives you a lower AC.

The bottom line is that Grimnir's suggestion with dual kamas is likely to be better, even though you lose the d20 damage for a mere d6 damage.
